title: French Revolution: Causes and Consequences

vocab.definition: Political upheaval in France (1789-1799) that overthrew monarchy
French social hierarchy dividing society into three classes
Document asserting fundamental human rights and freedoms
Period of violence during French Revolution with mass executions
Strong identification with and devotion to one's nation

teachingNotes: Analyze economic and social causes of revolution. Discuss how revolutionary ideas spread across Europe and influenced other movements.

sample.question: What political upheaval overthrew the French monarchy?
What is the Declaration of Rights?
What is the Reign of Terror?
What happened in Reign of Terror?

truefalse.question: The Estates System divided French society into three classes. (True or False)
The French Revolution occurred in 1789-1799. (True or False)
The Reign of Terror was peaceful. (True or False)
The French Revolution overthrew the monarchy. (True or False)
The Declaration of Rights asserted human freedoms. (True or False)
Nationalism means devotion to one's nation. (True or False)
The estates system had no social hierarchy. (True or False)
The Revolution had no causes. (True or False)
Revolutionary ideas spread across Europe. (True or False)
The Reign of Terror involved executions. (True or False)

multiplechoice.question: How many classes in estates system?
What was the period of violence?
What is devotion to one's nation?

fillintheblank.question: The _____ Revolution overthrew the French monarchy.
The _____ system divided society into three classes.
The Declaration of _____ asserted human freedoms.
The _____ of Terror was a period of violence.
_____ is strong devotion to one's nation.

shortanswer.question: What was the French Revolution?
expectedAny: Political upheaval in France from 1789-1799 that overthrew monarchy

shortanswer.question: What was the estates system?
expectedAny: French social hierarchy dividing society into three classes
System with clergy nobility and commoners

shortanswer.question: What was the Declaration of Rights?
expectedAny: Document asserting fundamental human rights and freedoms

shortanswer.question: What was the Reign of Terror?
expectedAny: Period of violence during French Revolution with mass executions
Time of revolutionary violence and guillotine

shortanswer.question: What is nationalism?
expectedAny: Strong identification with and devotion to one's nation

shortanswer.question: What caused the Revolution?
expectedAny: Economic inequality and social injustice in estates system

shortanswer.question: What did the Revolution achieve?
expectedAny: Ended monarchy and established rights and freedoms
Created republic and declared human rights

shortanswer.question: Why was the Reign of Terror significant?
expectedAny: Radical phase showing revolution's violence and extremism

shortanswer.question: How did revolutionary ideas spread?
expectedAny: Spread across Europe and influenced other movements
Ideas of rights and equality spread

shortanswer.question: What is the significance of nationalism?
expectedAny: Created national identity and unity movements
Inspired people to unite around shared nationality
